notes.text: ATTENTION: Remotely exploitable/low skill level to exploit
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: NCCIC/ICS-CERT recommends that users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: ICS-CERT reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: ICS-CERT also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available in the ICS -CERT Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies, that is available for download from the ICS-CERT web site.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to ICS-CERT for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target these vulnerabilities.
notes.title: Exploitability

document.title: BINOM3 Electric Power Quality Meter (Update A)

revision_history.summary: ICSA-17-031-01 BINOM3 Electric Power Quality Meter
ICSA-17-031-01A BINOM3 Electric Power Quality Meter (Update A)

product.name: BINOM3 power meters: Universal multifunctional electric power quality meter

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

notes.text: Input sent from a malicious client is not properly verified by the server. An attacker can execute arbitrary script code in another user 's browser session.CVE-2017-5164 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: BINOM3 has not created mitigations for these vulnerabilities.

notes.text: Lack of authentication for remote service gives access to application set up and configuration.CVE-2017-5162 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 10 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: BINOM3 has not created mitigations for these vulnerabilities.

notes.text: There is no CSRF Token generated per page and/or per (sensitive) function. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability can allow silent execution of unauthorized actions on the device such as configuration parameter changes, and saving modified configuration.CVE-2017-5165 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: BINOM3 has not created mitigations for these vulnerabilities.

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: This flaw can be used to gain privileged access to the device.CVE-2017-5166 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: BINOM3 has not created mitigations for these vulnerabilities.

notes.text: Users do not have any option to change their own passwords.CVE-2017-5167 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.6 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:L/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: BINOM3 has not created mitigations for these vulnerabilities.
